Indicates the maximum width for a line of text before it is wrapped to multiple lines. If null, 
the text will not be wrapped.

outline.description: If true, the text will be drawn as a stroke (outline). If false, the text will be drawn as a fill.

maxWidth.description: The maximum width to draw the text. If maxWidth is specified (not null), the text will be condensed or shrunk to make it fit in this width. For detailed information view the whatwg spec.

color.description: The color to draw the text in. Any valid value for the CSS color attribute is acceptable (ex. "#F00"). Default is "#000".

textBaseline.description: The vertical alignment point on the font. Any of "top", "hanging", "middle", "alphabetic", "ideographic", or "bottom". For detailed information view the whatwg spec. Default is "top".

lineHeight.description:
Indicates the line height (vertical distance between baselines) for multi-line text. If null or 0, 
the value of getMeasuredLineHeight is used.

font.description: The font style to use. Any valid value for the CSS font attribute is acceptable (ex. "bold 36px Arial").

textAlign.description: The horizontal text alignment. Any of "start", "end", "left", "right", and "center". For detailed information view the whatwg spec. Default is "left".

Text.description:
Allows you to display one or more lines of dynamic text (not user editable) in the display list.
Line wrapping support (using the lineWidth is very basic, wrapping on spaces and tabs only. Note
that as an alternative to Text, you can position HTML text above or below the canvas relative to 
items in the display list using the localToGlobal() method.

Bitmap.name: Bitmap

params.name: imageOrUri
params.description: The source object or URI to an image to display. This can be either an Image, Canvas, or Video object, or a string URI to an image file to load and use. If it is a URI, a new Image object will be constructed and assigned to the .image property.

constructors.description: A Bitmap represents an Image, Canvas, or Video in the display list.

params.name: ctx
params.description: The canvas 2D context object to draw into.

params.name: ignoreCache
params.description:
Indicates whether the draw operation should ignore any current cache. 
For example, used for drawing the cache (to prevent it from simply drawing an existing cache back
into itself).

draw.description:
Draws the display object into the specified context ignoring it's visible, alpha, shadow, and transform.
Returns true if the draw was handled (useful for overriding functionality).
NOTE: This method is mainly for internal use, though it may be useful for advanced uses.

uncache.description:
Because the content of a Bitmap is already in a simple format, cache is unnecessary for Bitmap instances.
You should not cache Bitmap instances as it can degrade performance.

cache.description:
Because the content of a Bitmap is already in a simple format, cache is unnecessary for Bitmap instances.
You should not cache Bitmap instances as it can degrade performance.

updateCache.description:
Because the content of a Bitmap is already in a simple format, cache is unnecessary for Bitmap instances.
You should not cache Bitmap instances as it can degrade performance.

return.description: a string representation of the instance.

toString.description: Returns a string representation of this object.

return.description: Boolean indicating whether the display object would be visible if drawn to a canvas

isVisible.description:
Returns true or false indicating whether the display object would be visible if drawn to a canvas.
This does not account for whether it would be visible within the boundaries of the stage.
NOTE: This method is mainly for internal use, though it may be useful for advanced uses.

return.description: a clone of the Bitmap instance.

clone.description: Returns a clone of the Bitmap instance.

image.description: The image to render. This can be an Image, a Canvas, or a Video.

snapToPixel.description: Whether or not the Bitmap should be draw to the canvas at whole pixel coordinates.

sourceRect.description: Specifies an area of the source image to draw. If omitted, the whole image will be drawn.

Bitmap.description: A Bitmap represents an Image, Canvas, or Video in the display list.

Shape.name: Shape

params.name: ctx
params.description: The canvas 2D context object to draw into.

params.name: ignoreCache
params.description:
Indicates whether the draw operation should ignore any current cache. 
For example, used for drawing the cache (to prevent it from simply drawing an existing cache back
into itself).

draw.description:
Draws the Shape into the specified context ignoring it's visible, alpha, shadow, and transform.
Returns true if the draw was handled (useful for overriding functionality).
NOTE: This method is mainly for internal use, though it may be useful for advanced uses.

return.description: Boolean indicating whether the Shape would be visible if drawn to a canvas

isVisible.description:
Returns true or false indicating whether the Shape would be visible if drawn to a canvas.
This does not account for whether it would be visible within the boundaries of the stage.
NOTE: This method is mainly for internal use, though it may be useful for advanced uses.

return.description: a string representation of the instance.

toString.description: Returns a string representation of this object.

params.name: recursive
params.description:
If true, this Shape's Graphics instance will also be cloned. If false, the Graphics instance 
will be shared with the new Shape.

clone.description:
Returns a clone of this Shape. Some properties that are specific to this instance's current context are reverted to 
their defaults (for example .parent).

Shape.param: {Graphics} graphics Optional. The graphics instance to display. If null, a new Graphics instance will be created.
Shape.description:
A Shape allows you to display vector art in the display list. It composites a Graphics instance which exposes all of the vector
drawing methods. The Graphics instance can be shared between multiple Shape instances to display the same vector graphics with different
positions or transforms. If the vector art will not change between draws, you may want to use the cache() method to reduce the rendering cost.

Touch.name: Touch

return.description: A boolean indicating whether touch is supported in the current browser.

isSupported.description: Returns true if touch is supported in the current browser.

return.description: Returns true if touch was successfully enabled on the target stage.

enable.description:
Enables touch interaction for the specified EaselJS stage. Currently supports iOS (and compatible browsers, such
as modern Android browsers), and IE10.
Supports both single touch and multi-touch modes. Extends the EaselJS MouseEvent model, but without support for
double click or over/out events. See MouseEvent.pointerID for more information.

params.name: stage
params.description: The stage to enable touch on.

params.name: singleTouch
params.description: If true, only a single touch will be active at a time. Default is false.

params.name: allowDefault
params.description: If true, then default gesture actions (ex. scrolling, zooming) will be allowed when the user is interacting with the target canvas. Default is false.

params.name: stage
params.description: The stage to disable touch on.

disable.description: Removes all listeners that were set up when calling Touch.enable on a stage.

Touch.description:
Global utility for working with multi-touch enabled devices in EaselJS. Currently supports W3C Touch API
(iOS & modern Android browser) and IE10.

Stage.name: Stage

params.name: canvas
params.description: The canvas the stage will render to.

constructors.description:
A stage is the root level Container for a display list. Each time its tick method is called, it will render its display
list to its target canvas.

params.name: event
params.description: A MouseEvent instance with information about the current mouse event.

onMouseMove.description:
The onMouseMove callback is called when the user moves the mouse over the canvas.  The handler is passed a single param
containing the corresponding MouseEvent instance.

params.name: event
params.description: A MouseEvent instance with information about the current mouse event.

onMouseUp.description:
The onMouseUp callback is called when the user releases the mouse button anywhere that the page can detect it.  The handler
is passed a single param containing the corresponding MouseEvent instance.

params.name: event
params.description: A MouseEvent instance with information about the current mouse event.

onMouseDown.description:
The onMouseDown callback is called when the user presses the mouse button over the canvas.  The handler is passed a single
param containing the corresponding MouseEvent instance.

return.description: A clone of the current Container instance.

clone.description: Returns a clone of this Stage.

return.description: a Base64 encoded image.

params.name: backgroundColor
params.description:
The background color to be used for the generated image. The value can be any value HTML color
value, including HEX colors, rgb and rgba. The default value is a transparent background.

params.name: mimeType
params.description:
The MIME type of the image format to be create. The default is "image/png". If an unknown MIME type
is passed in, or if the browser does not support the specified MIME type, the default value will be used.

toDataURL.description:
Returns a data url that contains a Base64 encoded image of the contents of the stage. The returned data url can be
specified as the src value of an image element.

update.description:
Each time the update method is called, the stage will tick any descendants exposing a tick method (ex. BitmapAnimation)
and render its entire display list to the canvas. Any parameters passed to update will be passed on to any
onTick handlers.

return.description: a string representation of the instance.

toString.description: Returns a string representation of this object.

params.name: frequency
params.description:
Optional param specifying the maximum number of times per second to broadcast mouse over/out events. Set to 0 to disable mouse
over events completely. Maximum is 50. A lower frequency is less responsive, but uses less CPU. Default is 20.

enableMouseOver.description:
Enables or disables (by passing a frequency of 0) mouse over handlers (onMouseOver and onMouseOut) for this stage's display
list. These events can be expensive to generate, so they are disabled by default, and the frequency of the events
can be controlled independently of mouse move events via the optional frequency parameter.

clear.description: Clears the target canvas. Useful if autoClear is set to false.

canvas.description:
The canvas the stage will render to. Multiple stages can share a single canvas, but you must disable autoClear for all but the
first stage that will be ticked (or they will clear each other's render).

tick.description: Calls the update method. Useful for adding stage as a listener to Ticker directly.

_pointerData.description:
Holds objects with data for each active pointer id. Each object has the following properties:
x, y, event, target, overTarget, overX, overY, inBounds

tickOnUpdate.description: If false, tick callbacks will be called on all display objects on the stage prior to rendering to the canvas.

autoClear.description:
Indicates whether the stage should automatically clear the canvas before each render. You can set this to false to manually
control clearing (for generative art, or when pointing multiple stages at the same canvas for example).

mouseY.description:
READ-ONLY. The current mouse Y position on the canvas. If the mouse leaves the canvas, this will indicate the most recent
position over the canvas, and mouseInBounds will be set to false.

mouseX.description:
READ-ONLY. The current mouse X position on the canvas. If the mouse leaves the canvas, this will indicate the most recent
position over the canvas, and mouseInBounds will be set to false.

mouseInBounds.description: Indicates whether the mouse is currently within the bounds of the canvas.

snapToPixelEnabled.description:
Indicates whether this stage should use the snapToPixel property of display objects when rendering them. See
DisplayObject.snapToPixel for more information.

Stage.description:
A stage is the root level Container for a display list. Each time its tick method is called, it will render its display
list to its target canvas.

Matrix2D.name: Matrix2D

params.name: a
params.description: Specifies the a property for the new matrix.

params.name: b
params.description: Specifies the b property for the new matrix.

params.name: c
params.description: Specifies the c property for the new matrix.

params.name: d
params.description: Specifies the d property for the new matrix.

params.name: tx
params.description: Specifies the tx property for the new matrix.

params.name: ty
params.description: Specifies the ty property for the new matrix.

constructors.description: Represents an affine transformation matrix, and provides tools for constructing and concatenating matrixes.

return.description: This matrix. Useful for chaining method calls.

identity.description: Sets the properties of the matrix to those of an identity matrix (one that applies a null transformation).

return.description: This matrix. Useful for chaining method calls.

params.name: angle
params.description: The angle in degrees.

rotate.description: Applies a rotation transformation to the matrix.

return.description: This matrix. Useful for chaining method calls.

params.name: target
params.description: The object to apply the transform properties to. If null, then a new object will be returned.

decompose.description:
Decomposes the matrix into transform properties (x, y, scaleX, scaleY, and rotation). Note that this these values
may not match the transform properties you used to generate the matrix, though they will produce the same visual
results.

return.description: This matrix. Useful for chaining method calls.

appendMatrix.description: Appends the specified matrix with this matrix.

return.description: a clone of the Matrix2D instance.

clone.description: Returns a clone of the Matrix2D instance.

return.description: This matrix. Useful for chaining method calls.

params.name: skewX
params.description: The amount to skew horizontally in degrees.

params.name: skewY
params.description: The amount to skew vertically in degrees.

skew.description: Applies a skew transformation to the matrix.

return.description: This matrix. Useful for chaining method calls.

params.name: alpha
params.description: desired alpha value

params.name: shadow
params.description: desired shadow value

params.name: compositeOperation
params.description: desired composite operation value

prependProperties.description: Prepends the specified visual properties to the current matrix.

return.description: This matrix. Useful for chaining method calls.

prepend.description: Concatenates the specified matrix properties with this matrix. All parameters are required.

return.description: This matrix. Useful for chaining method calls.

params.name: regX
params.description: Optional.

params.name: regY
params.description: Optional.

isIdentity.description: Returns true if the matrix is an identity matrix.

return.description: This matrix. Useful for chaining method calls.

scale.description: Applies a scale transformation to the matrix.

prependMatrix.description: Prepends the specified matrix with this matrix.

return.description: This matrix. Useful for chaining method calls.
a string representation of the instance.

toString.description: Returns a string representation of this object.

return.description: This matrix. Useful for chaining method calls.

translate.description: Translates the matrix on the x and y axes.

return.description: This matrix. Useful for chaining method calls.

params.name: regX
params.description: Optional.

params.name: regY
params.description: Optional.

return.description: This matrix. Useful for chaining method calls.

invert.description: Inverts the matrix, causing it to perform the opposite transformation.

return.description: This matrix. Useful for chaining method calls.

append.description: Appends the specified matrix properties with this matrix. All parameters are required.

return.description: This matrix. Useful for chaining method calls.

appendProperties.description: Reinitializes all matrix properties to those specified.

params.name: alpha
params.description: desired alpha value

params.name: shadow
params.description: desired shadow value

params.name: compositeOperation
params.description: desired composite operation value

a.description: Position (0, 0) in a 3x3 affine transformation matrix.

c.description: Position (1, 0) in a 3x3 affine transformation matrix.

b.description: Position (0, 1) in a 3x3 affine transformation matrix.

d.description: Position (1, 1) in a 3x3 affine transformation matrix.

ty.description: Position (2, 1) in a 3x3 affine transformation matrix.

compositeOperation.description: Property representing the compositeOperation that will be applied to a display object. This is not part of matrix operations, but is used for operations like getConcatenatedMatrix to provide concatenated compositeOperation values. You can find a list of valid composite operations at: https://developer.mozilla.org/en/Canvas_tutorial/Compositing

atx.description: Position (2, 0) in a 3x3 affine transformation matrix.

alpha.description:
Property representing the alpha that will be applied to a display object. This is not part of matrix
operations, but is used for operations like getConcatenatedMatrix to provide concatenated alpha values.

DEG_TO_RAD.description: Multiplier for converting degrees to radians. Used internally by Matrix2D. Read-only.

shadow.description:
Property representing the shadow that will be applied to a display object. This is not part of matrix
operations, but is used for operations like getConcatenatedMatrix to provide concatenated shadow values.

identity.description: An identity matrix, representing a null transformation. Read-only.

Matrix2D.description: Represents an affine transformation matrix, and provides tools for constructing and concatenating matrixes.

EaselJS.description:
The EaselJS Javascript library provides a retained graphics mode for canvas
including a full, hierarchical display list, a core interaction model, and
helper classes to make working with 2D graphics in Canvas much easier.
EaselJS.name: EaselJS
